name: ClothoOutro
_source: s;Morrissey;Ah... blood...{w} It's been so long...
s;Morrissey;Surrender?{w} Hah... hah...|Even now, so naive...
s;Simon;I'm merciful.{w} That's something you'll never understand.

s;Morrissey;Hah! I was merciful once.{w} I too have spared my adversaries.|Allowed bandits to reintegrate into villages, rebellious lords to return to their manors.|And my mercy was always met with a new betrayal!
s;Simon;So you yourself became a traitor.

s;Morrissey;I became focused.{w} A noble's strength, not their character, is what matters.|Tell me, Simon: are you ready to crush rebellions?|Wipe out villages to set a necessary example?|Execute lords for treason?
s;Morrissey;Because when you take my head, and my throne, you will become that tyrant.|It is inevitable.
s;Morrissey;If you cannot accept that, then burn!
s;Anuki;...{w} I chose to side with you.|I knew where that would lead.
s;Simon;I'm not ready to become him.{w} I... don't want this.
s;Anuki;It is the fate of nobles, I think.|To triumph or... die.
s;Simon;Then I want no part of it.
s;Simon;Hatshepsut said there were... distant lands.|That we could escape there, if needed.
s;Simon;Between that, becoming a tyrant, or laying in a pool of my own blood...
s;Anuki;I understand.{w} I don't wish for us to meet this fate either.
s;Anuki;We're still engaged, aren't we?|Nobles or not, I don't see why that should change.
s;Anuki;Simon, if we choose to do this...|We leave our violent lives behind here.
s;Simon;Agreed. No mercenary groups, no noble allies...|No more killing.
s;Anuki;Then, c'mon.{w} Let's go find Hatshepsut.
s;Luther;Lord Verstadt. You are victorious.|Your triumph is complete.
s;Simon;And yet I want none of it.
s;Simon;Lord Morrissey spoke to me before...|He said that I'll adopt his cruel tactics.
s;Luther;The ravings of a madman on his deathbed.|Pay them no heed.
s;Simon;But... haven't I already begun to?
s;Simon;Since we've set out, I feel more... at ease, with violence.|The battlefield is my first solution to every problem.|And now Anuki... I've killed even her...
s;Luther;Violence is the way of a noble, milord.
s;Simon;Then I want no connection to that title.
s;Luther;I watched your father follow the same path as Lord Morrissey.|It is a... doomed... position.
s;Simon;I didn't know...{w} Then... it is done.|Hatshepsut said there were... distant lands.|That we could escape there, if needed.
s;Luther;Aye. We can easily charter a ship in Port Hull.
s;Luther;What we shall do, milord.{w} I cannot speak for all our company,|but Vincent, Juliet, and I were never loyal to your title.|We are loyal to you.
s;Simon;Thank you, Luther. A thousand times over.
s;Luther;Come now, Simon.{w} Let us leave this wretched continent behind.
